summary:
This mod adds some new dialogue to Erlindir of the Drunken Huntsman.
He also sells a couple of magic items of dubious quality.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ff00ff][size=5]There's not enough merriment in Skyrim. Sorry, Cicero doesn't count. Where's the funny stuff?
So here's this little thing. It's not exactly funny, but it can be mistaken for vaguely humorous in a dim light.[/size][/color]

[color=#3c78d8][size=4][u]Description:[/u][/size][/color]
[color=#ff0000]What magic turns cheese to wine?
Speak to Elrindir at the Drunken Huntsman in Whiterun.[/color]
[color=#980000]Discount Magic Items!
Elrindir also has some nifty, oh-so-helpful gear for sale.[/color]
[color=#ff7700]The Why Of Questing
Speak to Seren in Dawnstar. She may have a new quest for you. Or maybe not.[/color]
[color=#ffff00]Serendipitous Silversmith Stupidity
Kerah of Markarth has a job for you.[/color]

This is one of those mods you install, try out, say "Huh!" to yourself, and uninstall to clear up space in your load order.
Give it ten minutes and hopefully it'll elicit a chuckle or two, and that's about it.

[color=#3c78d8][size=4][u]To-do list:[/u][/size][/color]
Eh, I dunno... not much, really.
Maybe go in and fix emotion levels.
I should really also add "not enough money" checks so you can't get away with getting items for free.
I also need to fix the scroll - missing a casting effect.
I should also add in an actual magic effect for the gauntlets. And the horn, and the wand...
More sketches!
Actually, I guess there's a sizeable list of things to do. Ah, well... maybe some day. Soon?

[color=#3c78d8][size=4][u]FAQ:[/u][/size][/color]
Generally "FAQ" requires questions to be asked frequently. In this case, I'm trying to anticipate questions instead.
 
Q: I'm having a problem with this mod.
A: That's not only possible, it's likely. I'm a newb to modding. Leave a comment and I'll get back to you. I can't guarantee I can fix a problem, but I'll do my best. :)
 
Q: I have a question about this or any other mod. Should I PM you?
A: No, please. Use the comment thread. That's what it is there for.
 
Q: Your mod conflicts with <other mod>.
A: That is highly unlikely, although I suppose if anything massively alters Elrindir it's certainly possible. In general, for stuff like this, put whichever one you want more lower on the list.
 
Q: Can I suggest <feature> or <NPC>?
A: Yes please! I can't guarantee the request will get into the mod, because as I've said I'm not very good at modding, but I'll certainly consider it!
 
Q: Can I translate your mod?
A: Certainly! I didn't write it with any sort of translation in mind, though, and I do tend to use American English idioms and phrasing, so... good luck! Go ahead and post your translation in the support thread and I will link to it in the download page. If you do make a translation, be a lamb and either send me the file so I can upload it, or at least post a link so I can add it to the description.
 
Q: Can I or you upload this to another site?
A: I'd rather you didn't.

Q: What about patches or updates?
A: Make a request or suggestion!
author: Content Consumer
